replies.bodyText: I installed 3.1.2, which was the same as the circle ci config :( Any ideas?
replies.author: agduncan94

replies.bodyText: so in the last PR, it looks like the it was supposed to be 3.1.2.  now it looks like the new version (the one mentioned in develop).  i think someone else merged a openapi.yaml with a new version of yq between the two base branches
replies.author: garyluu

replies.bodyText: Should I run again with yq 3.3.2 (from develop)?
replies.author: agduncan94

replies.bodyText:
It's worth a shot, or at least 3.3.1 looks like my install says this
$ snap info yq
name:      yq
summary:   A lightweight and portable command-line YAML processor
publisher: Mike Farah (mikefarah)
store-url: https://snapcraft.io/yq
contact:   https://github.com/mikefarah/yq/issues
license:   unset
description: |
  The aim of the project is to be the jq or sed of yaml files.
commands:
  - yq
snap-id:      b1xa1ED1Aw4HN9BnJVP3Je95pyEVN6gu
tracking:     latest/stable
refresh-date: 60 days ago, at 21:13 EDT
channels:
  latest/stable:    3.3.1 2020-06-11 (736) 2MB -
  latest/candidate: ↑                          
  latest/beta:      ↑                          
  latest/edge:      3.3.2 2020-06-15 (772) 2MB -
installed:          3.3.1            (736) 2MB -
replies.author: denis-yuen

timeline.bodyText:
Totally optional, but only because it took me a bit to understand this: Either add a comment saying something to the effect that there is no need to change because the version has not changed, or create a function for the if condition whose name represents that.
I guess the disconnect is that cognitively SKIP_COMMIT_ID != unmodified to me.
